intro: Lyperia fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant lyperia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The fragrance of its flowers is one of its most distinctive features, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
